com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24

Class ID3v24Tag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.ID3v24Tag

  • public class ID3v24Tag
extends java.lang.Object

    This class provides methods for reading and writing an ID3V2.4 tag. It provides direct low level access to the actual ID3v2.4 tag embedded in an .mp3 file. The tag is where all the information about the .mp3 file is stored. Information such as the song title, the track number, the lyrics of the song, the band who recorded the song, etc. are stored inside the tag. As shown below, a tag is composed of the four parts: header, extended header, frames, and either padding or a footer.

     
    ID3v2.4 Tag Fields
    Field Description
    header Holds the ID3 tag identifier, the total tag size, etc.
    extended headerOptional field which is present only if the extendedHeaderPresent flag is set in the header. This extended header has fields which are not vital to the reading of the ID3v2.4 tag.
    frames List of frames that contains the actual information about the .mp3 file.
    padding Unused area filled with 0's which allows the tag to grow without having to re-write the whole .mp3 file. For example, if the user adds a frame specifying the track number, then the tag can take some space from the padding in order to add the frame and doesn't need to re-write the entire .mp3 file. However, if a footer is present, then no padding may appear in the tag. That is, padding and the footer are mutually exclusive. Only one of the two may be present in the ID3v2.4 tag.
    footer Optional field that holds the ID3v2.4 tag footer. If present, then no padding may appear in the ID3v2.4 tag.

    It is beyond the scope of this class description to explain the complete details of the ID3v2.4 tag. However, if you need more information about the format of the ID3v2.4 tag, please visit the official ID3v2.4 website.

    See Also:
    ID3 tag version 2.4.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags, Gigamonkeys ID3 Tag parser

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_PADDING_SIZE
      amount of padding (in bytes) that will be added when the ID3v2.4 tag runs out of room for frames and needs to be resized.

      • DEFAULT_PADDING_SIZE

        public static int DEFAULT_PADDING_SIZE

    • Constructor Detail

      • ID3v24Tag

        public ID3v24Tag()
        default constructor. Called when creating a new ID3v2.4 tag.

      • ID3v24Tag

        public ID3v24Tag(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
          throws java.io.IOException
        constructor. Called when reading an existing ID3v2.4 tag from an .mp3 file. If any invalid frames are encountered while parsing the ID3v2.4 tag, then the frames are simply tagged as invalid, and are added to the list of invalid frames. See the ID3v24FrameHeader class for more details on the Beaglebuddy MP3 library's error handling.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream mp3 file whose ID3v2.4 tag is to be read. The input stream has already read in the ID3v2.4 tag header id/version bytes and is pointing to the remainder of the header.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was an error while loading the ID3v2.4 tag from the .mp3 file.

      • getExtendedHeader

        public ID3v24TagExtendedHeader getExtendedHeader()
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        get the optional ID3v2.4 tag extended header. This method may only be called when the tag header's extendedHeaderPresent flag is set.
        Returns:
        the optional ID3v2.4 extended header. If not present, then null is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the extendedHeaderPresent flag is not set.
        See Also:
        setExtendedHeader(ID3v24TagExtendedHeader), ID3v24TagHeader.isExtendedHeaderPresent(), ID3v24TagHeader.setExtendedHeaderPresent(boolean)

      • getFrame

        public ID3v24Frame getFrame(FrameType frameType)

        Parameters:
        frameType - type of ID3v2.4 frame to search for.
        Returns:
        the first ID3v2.4 frame with the given ID3v2.4 frame id found in the ID3v2.4 tag, or null if no frame with the specified id can be found.

      • getFrames

        public java.util.List<ID3v24Frame> getFrames(FrameType frameType)
        finds all the ID3v2.4 frames in the ID3v2.4 tag with the specified ID3v2.4 frame id.
        Parameters:
        frameType - type of ID3v2.4 frames to retrieve from the ID3v2.4 tag.
        Returns:
        a list of all the ID3v2.4 frames with the given ID3v2.4 frame id that were found in the ID3v2.4 tag, or an empty collection of size 0 if no ID3v2.4 frame with the specified ID3v2.4 id can be found.

      • removeFrame

        Returns:
        the ID3v2.4 frame in the ID3v2.4 tag with the given ID3v2.4 frame id that was removed, or null if no ID3v2.4 frame with the specified id was found.

      • getPadding

        public byte[] getPadding()
        gets the amount of padding at the end of the ID3v2.4 tag. This padding dictactes how much room remains for the frames to expand within the ID3v2.4 tag before the ID3v2.4 tag has to be resized and thus the .mp3 file rewritten.
        Returns:
        the length of the padding after the ID3v2.4 tag.
        See Also:
        setPadding(int)

      • setPadding

        public void setPadding(int size)
        sets the amount of padding that should be reserved at the end of the ID3v2.4 tag.
        Parameters:
        size - the size (in bytes) of the new padding.
        See Also:
        getPadding()

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        gets the size (in bytes) of the ID3v2.4 tag in the .mp3 file. This includes the tag header, frames, padding, and footer.
        Returns:
        the size of the ID3v2.4 tag.

      • getVersion

        public ID3TagVersion getVersion()

      • isDirty

        public boolean isDirty()
        gets whether the ID3v2.4 tag has been modified since the last time it was saved.
        Returns:
        whether the ID3v2.4 tag has been modified.

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer()
        if the tag's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the tag is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
          throws java.io.IOException
        save the ID3v2.4 tag to the .mp3 file.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - output stream pointing to the starting location of the ID3v2.4 tag within the .mp3 file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there was an error writing the ID3v2.4 tag to the .mp3 file.
